summary: This is an email chain from August 19, 2019, forwarding a letter motion from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Berman's chambers. The motion requests court approval for an order of nolle prosequi (dismissal of charges) in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB). The email indicates the motion was filed that afternoon and copies defense counsel.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Copied on the email as defense counsel in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Copied on the email as defense counsel in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

persons.name: Berman
persons.context: The email is addressed to the chambers of Judge Berman, who is presiding over the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

connections.description: Both are listed as defense counsel copied on the same legal correspondence regarding the motion to dismiss charges against Epstein.

events.title: Government files motion for nolle prosequi
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a letter motion requesting the court approve an order of nolle prosequi (dismissal of charges) in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

keyFacts: On August 19, 2019, the government filed a motion seeking dismissal of charges (nolle prosequi) against Jeffrey Epstein in case 19 Cr. 490.
The motion was submitted to Judge Berman's chambers in the Southern District of New York.
Defense counsel Martin Weinberg and Michael Miller were copied on the correspondence.
The document is a direct record of the procedural step to drop the federal charges against Epstein shortly before his death.
